SENT.plain: A 59-year-old woman was diagnosed with incomplete type BehÃ§et's syndrome in 1994
The patient was hospitalized with pharyngitis and fever in August 2000, and was treated using non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)
Symptoms improved and she was discharged
After only 3 weeks, she reported swallowing disturbance due to retrosternal pain
Esophagoscopy revealed multiple shallow oval ulcerations in the middle esophagus
Colonoscopy revealed aphthous lesions in the rectum
Prednisolone (0.5 mg/kg) was initiated for treatment of esophageal involvement
Symptoms gradually improved and subsequent esophagoscopy revealed complete healing of esophageal ulcerations
